timeline.bodyText: From what I could find, deletedAt and deleteDelay is only set using System.nanoTime/1000000, so there should not be any mismatch from comparing times that used nanoTime and times that used currentTimeMillis
timeline.author: ebehrendt

replies.bodyText: It might be a good idea to update the BlobFileToDelete class to make it explicit via the javadoc (actually it doesn't have any) that the getDeletedAt() returns the timestamp in milliseconds
replies.author: andyvuong

timeline.bodyText: I'd consider making System.nanoTime() / 1000000 a util method in BlobStoreUtils
timeline.author: andyvuong

timeline.message: Incorporate CR feedback to move time to a utility function. Use TimeUnit java util to convert from nanoseconds to milliseconds.

timeline.bodyText: Why not just call it getCurrentTimeMs and let the javadoc make it clear it's not the same as System.currentTimeMillis(), the main reason being it was changed originally to fix ant precommit failures?
timeline.author: andyvuong

replies.bodyText: Sure - I had named this way to avoid combining with currentTimeMillis but if the javadoc is good enough for that I'll rename
replies.author: ebehrendt

timeline.message: Rename method from getCurrentNanoTimeInMs to getCurrentTimeMs
